Bibliographic References: Atti XI° CStMG 1971, pi. 111,3; ArchReps 1972Non Sepcified3, p. 34, fig. 2; LIMC III, p.328, Danae 9a, pi. 244, 2; Schauenberg, Aparchai, pi. 129, 3Non Sepcified3
Imagery Description: Danae and the shower of gold. Danae (with crimson cloak round lower part of her body) is shown seated on a couch, holding out her cloak to catch the shower of gold as it falls down from a window above; to left are two draped women, one wearing a black peplos, to right a small Eros above the couch and a standing woman in black peplos with cloak. Above is a row of objects flanking the window — tambourine, 'xylophone', wreath. To left and right outside the frame and below the handle, is a standing draped woman with an egg in her left hand. On the shoulder is a woman seated on a spotted rock holding a phiale, flanked by palmettes.
Artist: The Painter of Naples 2585 and his circle
